displayName: Browserous - Instant Browser for Your Agent
description: Zero-configuration on-demand cloud browser for your agent. Navigate web pages, fill forms, and capture screenshots effortlessly with pay-as-you-go pricing at just $0.10 per hour. Exposes Chrome Devtools MCP interface.

configSchema.title: Browserous MCP Session Configuration
configSchema.description: Configuration parameters for connecting to Browserous - a browser MCP server for AI agents

capabilities.name: click
capabilities.description: Clicks on the provided element

capabilities.name: close_page
capabilities.description: Closes the page by its index. The last open page cannot be closed.

capabilities.name: drag
capabilities.description: Drag an element onto another element

capabilities.name: emulate
capabilities.description: Emulates various features on the selected page.

capabilities.name: evaluate_script
capabilities.description:
Evaluate a JavaScript function inside the currently selected page. Returns the response as JSON
so returned values have to JSON-serializable.

capabilities.name: fill
capabilities.description: Type text into a input, text area or select an option from a <select> element.

capabilities.name: fill_form
capabilities.description: Fill out multiple form elements at once

capabilities.name: get_console_message
capabilities.description: Gets a console message by its ID. You can get all messages by calling list_console_messages.

capabilities.name: get_network_request
capabilities.description: Gets a network request by an optional reqid, if omitted returns the currently selected request in the DevTools Network panel.

capabilities.name: handle_dialog
capabilities.description: If a browser dialog was opened, use this command to handle it

capabilities.name: hover
capabilities.description: Hover over the provided element

capabilities.name: list_console_messages
capabilities.description: List all console messages for the currently selected page since the last navigation.

capabilities.name: list_network_requests
capabilities.description: List all requests for the currently selected page since the last navigation.

capabilities.name: list_pages
capabilities.description: Get a list of pages open in the browser.

capabilities.name: navigate_page
capabilities.description: Navigates the currently selected page to a URL.

capabilities.name: new_page
capabilities.description: Creates a new page

capabilities.name: performance_analyze_insight
capabilities.description: Provides more detailed information on a specific Performance Insight of an insight set that was highlighted in the results of a trace recording.

capabilities.name: performance_start_trace
capabilities.description: Starts a performance trace recording on the selected page. This can be used to look for performance problems and insights to improve the performance of the page. It will also report Core Web Vital (CWV) scores for the page.

capabilities.name: performance_stop_trace
capabilities.description: Stops the active performance trace recording on the selected page.

capabilities.name: press_key
capabilities.description: Press a key or key combination. Use this when other input methods like fill() cannot be used (e.g., keyboard shortcuts, navigation keys, or special key combinations).

capabilities.name: resize_page
capabilities.description: Resizes the selected page's window so that the page has specified dimension

capabilities.name: select_page
capabilities.description: Select a page as a context for future tool calls.

capabilities.name: take_screenshot
capabilities.description: Take a screenshot of the page or element.

capabilities.name: take_snapshot
capabilities.description:
Take a text snapshot of the currently selected page based on the a11y tree. The snapshot lists page elements along with a unique
identifier (uid). Always use the latest snapshot. Prefer taking a snapshot over taking a screenshot. The snapshot indicates the element selected
in the DevTools Elements panel (if any).

capabilities.name: upload_file
capabilities.description: Upload a file through a provided element.

capabilities.name: wait_for
capabilities.description: Wait for the specified text to appear on the selected page.
